Key Arguments: The proposed legislation infringes on the right to freedom of opinion and expression as outlined in the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
Freedom of speech is fundamental to democracy, and any restriction on it is a threat to democratic principles.
The bill is seen as a step towards government control and repression, likened to communism and the World Economic Forum's 'Great Reset'.
Historical examples are cited to argue that silencing opposition leads to repressive government measures.
The submission references the COVID-19 pandemic as an example where dissenting voices were silenced, particularly regarding treatments and vaccine safety.
Main Themes: Historical and Contemporary Examples of Silencing Dissent
COVID-19 Pandemic as a Case Study
Notable Quotes: Australians value the right to say what we think without fear of consequences. Only communism restricts free speech.
This bill seeks to overthrow the freedoms we have enjoyed as a nation and put us into a form of slavery and control.
A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
